ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Essential class to get a grasp on East European political history and contemporary political thinking.
You learn a lot about Eastern Europe.

Gained a much deeper historic and philosophic understanding of the region, and how the regional ideas impacted the wider European and international structures. Seminars were very engaging, discussions with Professor Snyder are amazing and an absolute privilege. Don't be scared off by the on-the-spot presentations - it is scary at first, but an amazing experience and you learn a lot. Coursework in the form of NYRB Style was of great help in deeper understanding of books and were a great writing exercise. Take this course - you will love it!
History of Eastern Europe: conflicts and relationship among the nations The most important thing I learned is about how to learn history, how to think like a historian

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It might be better if weekly reading requirements are limited to 2 books.
The course is very clear and well-organized
The amount of reading might seem intimidating at first, but in a few weeks you will get used to it. You will read a lot, but will also learn a lot. No weaknesses, amazing course.
The readings are extremely interesting. After discussion in class, we can have a better understanding of them. It is perfect. Prof Snyder is perfect to organize the discussion

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Highly recommended. Essential class to get a grasp on East European political history and contemporary political thinking.
Yes, it is a pleasure to take classes with professor Snyder
Absolutely yes. This will be one of the best history courses you will ever take.
Sure! It makes me feel the beauty of history and necessity to learn history.
